concept.title: Using point filters in three dimensions
concept.shortdesc: You can use point filters when you work in three-dimensionalspace to locate points in two dimensions and then specify the z coordinate as the elevation above the xy plane. For example, to begin drawing a line from a point with a z coordinate 3 units above the center of a circle, insert the circle, and then start the Line command and respond to the prompts as follows:

conbody.p: Specify the center point of circle or [3P/2P/Ttr (tangency tangency
radius)]: .xy Select XY of: cen CenterPoint
You can use point filters to draw a line by first selecting a point in the xy plane (A), specifying the z coordinate (B), and then specifying the length of line (C).
